keyTakeAways: Prince Andrew is under investigation by London police for allegedly asking a bodyguard officer to dig up dirt on Virginia Giuffre, a sexual assault accuser, in 2011.
The investigation follows revelations that Andrew maintained contact with Jeffrey Epstein after 2010, including a 2011 email stating they were 'in this together'.
Giuffre, who was allegedly trafficked by Epstein in 2001, died by suicide in April 2025, adding emotional weight to the ongoing allegations.
Andrew denied all allegations in a public statement, though he acknowledged Giuffre's suffering in a 2022 out-of-court settlement.
The British government, including Energy Secretary Ed Miliband, condemned the idea of using a close protection officer to conduct a smear campaign.
Giuffre’s family welcomed Andrew’s relinquishment of royal titles but urged King Charles III to strip Andrew of his title as prince.
The scandal intensified after the publication of Giuffre’s posthumous memoir and media reports about Andrew’s actions in 2011.

summaryOfNewsArticle: London police are investigating whether Prince Andrew, in 2011, asked a bodyguard officer to investigate Virginia Giuffre’s criminal record, raising serious allegations of a smear campaign. The probe follows years of controversy, including his alleged continued contact with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and a 2019 public apology after a damaging interview. Giuffre, who was allegedly trafficked by Epstein in 2001, died by suicide in April 2025, and her family welcomed Andrew’s relinquishment of royal titles but called for a full stripping of his title by King Charles III. Though Andrew acknowledged Giuffre’s suffering in a 2022 settlement, he continues to deny wrongdoing. The British government, including Energy Secretary Ed Miliband, has condemned the use of a close protection officer for such a purpose, emphasizing ethical concerns.
title: Police Looking Into Whether Prince Andrew Enlisted Officer to Dig Up Dirt on Accuser Giuffre
